title: Fed’s Williams Says Treasury Market Has Faced Too Many Shocks
sub_head: ‘Three episodes of market dysfunction over the past decade are too many,’ the New York Fed chief says
body:
Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said that more work needs to be done to improve the resiliency of the U.S. Treasury securities market.
“A well-functioning U.S. Treasury market is critically important for our economy and, in fact, the entire world,” Mr. Williams said in text for a speech Wednesday. “It enables the safe and stable flow of capital and credit to households, businesses and governments.”
In...
